metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2746 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
389 Directory Server before 1.2.11.6 (aka Red Hat Directory Server before 8.2.10-3), when the password of a LDAP user has been changed and audit logging is enabled, saves the new password to the log in plain text, which allows remote authenticated users to read the password.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2746` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.2.16-0ubuntu1
389-ds-base - 1.3.2.16-0ubuntu1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.2.16-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.2.16-0ubuntu1').
